issues.description: Method name/signature mismatch for the Farm song method: the problem statement and UML refer to printFarmSong(), while both the template and the solution implement/expect a method named singFarmSong(). This inconsistency can confuse students about which method they must implement (they may implement printFarmSong() as requested by the text but the template/tests use singFarmSong()), and it may cause compilation/test failures or wasted effort.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the method name consistent across all artifacts. Either (A) update the problem statement/UML to refer to singFarmSong() (matching template and solution), or (B) rename the template/solution method to printFarmSong() (or add a printFarmSong() wrapper that delegates to singFarmSong()). Ensure the task text, UML, template stubs, and solution all use the same method name so students are not confused.

issues.description: The problem statement instructs students to implement a method named printFarmSong() (UML and Part 3 description), but both the template and the reference solution provide and use a differently named method singFarmSong(). This mismatch between 'printFarmSong' (problem text/UML) and 'singFarmSong' (template & solution code) can confuse students about which method to implement or override and may lead to mismatches with provided stubs/tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Use a single consistent method name across all artifacts. Either (A) update the problem statement and UML to refer to singFarmSong() (recommended, since the template and solution already use that name), or (B) rename the method in the template and solution from singFarmSong() to printFarmSong() so they match the problem text. Ensure the chosen name is used consistently in UML, instructions, template stubs, and tests.
